p:
Model sensitivity was characterized using 500 simulations runs for dengue parameter ranges as given in Table 2. All parameters were uniformly distributed for the LHS sampling. The conditions here were permissive for epidemics, with ( I
h > 2) in 256 of the 500 simulated parameter sets. The epidemic progression in these parameter sets was consistent with the general model behavior seen in Fig 2A and 2C (i.e. a combination of unimodal and bimodal responses). The distribution of the QOI had a wider range of values (i.e. MaxI
h = 3 to 7595 humans infected; tmaxI
h = 31 to 512 days from t
crit ; cumI
h = 0.01% to 100% of the population infected), thus providing adequate variation for the sensitivity analysis.
